page.title: 10RECREATION IN HUNTLY
page.content: BOWLING. The bowling green is on Richmond Road. It was built in 1885 and is 100 years old this year. There are 200 members; 140 men and 60 women. There is a big waiting list for membership. There is a Huntly bowling team. To be a member you pay each year. To buy a set of bowls costs about Â£100. FISHING. There are two rivers, the Deveron and the Bogie. When you start fishing you need a permit which you can get at the local sports shop. The permit costs five pounds at first but after that it goes down to two pounds a year. The fishers mainly fish for Salmon or Trout. THE MARKET MUIR is open for anybody to use. There are facilities for Boys League Football, Rugby and picnic areas.
